title: (x) This might be a hard one - Poetica {Tiff}
content:
Anybody where this symbol comes from?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [symbol.jpg](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=symbol.jpg) | 26.92 KB |
author: popinfresh

comments.content: Where did you get this sample? First thought was DF Calligraphic Ornaments, but then I realized that it is missing the finer strokes/details. Poetica?
Oh! I am good! ;^P It is [Poetica Supplemental Ornaments Cap N](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111165950/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/poetica/supp-ornaments/).

Whoa! _WHOA!!!_ Tiff you are _SO IN-FRIGGIN-CREDIBLY GOOD_ it hurts!

_I thought I had recognized Slimbach’s hand and checked the Minion OpenType flourishes, to no avail. What you just pulled off caused a major short-circuit in my brain synapses. I think I need to lie down now…_

You sure are goooood..  
( _I may second Yves.:_ What a find, Tiff.. :) _Nice one.._ )

No. Not really. Just lucky to have had a bit of a Poetica addiction once upon a time to the point of printing out samples and hanging it on my wall. I bow before true MTID (Masters of Type Identification) such as Mike, Mark, Yves and Karl. I was being incredibly sarcastic. Thanks guys.

:^)
